CatDescriptText: Helena Golightly, beauty shop proprietor, 2114 Wylie Avenue was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 16, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think the main issues will be, or should be, in the coming presidential campaign?" Answer reads: "Everyone should get together on civil rights and we should all pull together."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Helena Golightly wearing light colored shirt dress, standing in front of car, building in background
